script: MAN: Okay, I think you're next.
Just come right around this way just a little bit.
Put your books down on your lap, okay?
Now look right up at the camera, okay?
Let me focus right over here.
Swing around this way just a little bit, Gina.
So how'd yours come out, Rink?
Yeah, mine aren't so hot either.
I'll meet you out front, okay?
It's not like she needs a play-by-play.
Uh, Jenna, could I talk to you a tiny sec?
So, I told Chris Grandy me and the Six Chicks were going to your party tonight, and he said he wanted to come with.
Yeah, it's too bad we can't make it, because we really wanted to.
Yeah, Miss Measly's totally up our butts with this group project proposal, and Chris is gonna come over and help us out, so I guess he can't come either.
I could write your report for you.
You know, I can't believe you invited those clones.
The Six Chicks are not your friends, okay?
Well, almost, and some day, I'm gonna be a Six Chick.
There's six of them, Jenna. That's the whole point.
There can't be a seventh Six Chick.
Besides, you're way cooler than they are.
I don't want to be original, Matty.
Tell us about your new life as a teenager, Jenna!
Jenna, it's going to be all right.
Just because you don't look like these girls in Poise Magazine doesn't mean that you're not beautiful in your own way.
I don't want to be beautiful in my own way.
I want to look like these people.
Why the 30s are the best years of your life.
Well, you will be, honey, but right now, you're my beautiful 13-year-old.
This is just part one of your present.
I got something else to give you later.
You know how you always wanted a Barbie Dream House?
I decided to make you your own...
See, that's you in your bubble bath reading your favorite magazine, and, uh...
there's your bedroom, with a massive stereo and every record ever made-- the good ones-- and, uh...
there's that bum, Rick Springfield, loafing on the couch...
and there I am to make sure the creep keeps his hands to himself.
It says, uh, This wishing dust knows what's in your heart of hearts.
It'll make all your dreams come true.
Matt, I'm just gonna put this away, okay?
Dad, you promised you were gonna stay upstairs.
I'm gonna go next door and get my Casio.
It's not like I need a play-by-play.
Hey, I have an idea, girls.
Let's play Seven Minutes in Heaven, and you can go first, because you're the birthday girl.
How does that one go again?
TOM-TOM: Well, you go in the closet, and some lucky guy's gonna go in there and do whatever he wants with you...
for seven whole minutes, and guess who wants to go first?
Um, before I forget, where's our project proposal?
Keep that blindfold on, and just so you know, Chris loves going for second base.
I think I can get my brother to buy us some beer.
Wait, give me that drink. Thank you.
Come on, we're out of here.
Uh, Jenna's waiting for you in the closet.
I thought you weren't gonna come.
No, I just went next door to get my Casio.
Just let me talk to you!
Jenna, what are you talking about?
Just let me play you this song, okay?

Well, we're not that sorry, because we're cruising in the Caribbean, so we'll be back on the 18th, so call us then.
You went on a cruise without me?
This is a really weird dream.
I know you're there, and my parents are totally gonna be home any minute!
MAN: You can join me if you want!
Can you hurry up a little bit, please?
Jenna? Can you come over here?
I don't care if you have to grab him by his testicles.
I want him in New York in 12 hours.
He needs to be at the party.
I don't get in the car with strangers.
I can't. I don't know you.
I don't get in the car with strangers!
Don't make me come down there and grab you.
Could you get in the car?
Look, just-- He made a commitment.
Honey, I know I'm your best friend, but the slip dress is a little '97.
Are you really my best friend?
What did you do last night?
I slept in an apartment I've never seen before...
and there was a naked man in my shower, and I...
Driver, could you please pull over, since we're here? Stop!
Wait. I don't want to get out of the-- I don't think you're listening.
Jenna, if you're gonna start lying about your age, I'd go with 27.
That's just-- Wait, I know it sounds strange, but, like, some weird dream-- Like that! Do you hear it?
Put on your pants and stop calling me Sweet Bottom.
Baby, I-- And get out of my house!
Hey, look, I-- Who is that?
I don't know what to do.
We have a meeting in 10 minutes, okay?
I'm gonna tell you what to do.
I am Jenna Rink, big time magazine editor.
I am Jenna Rink, big time magazine editor.
I'm gonna walk into that office, I'm not gonna let anyone know I'm hung over-- But that's not the point.
I'm gonna walk into that office and not let anyone know I'm hung over.
Because the future of Poise depends on me.
Please don't yell at me, because it's not my fault, but they came in late and they need a decision now.
I trust my executive editors are late again because they were out promoting us at all the right parties?
Oh, you're not gonna go to Fire Island this summer?
MAN: Are you insinuating I'm gay?
MAN: I think you should wear the Gucci.
Is there anything else you need from me, Miss Rink?
Actually, I need to find this guy.
Arlene, will you leave us, please?
Jenna's a little hung over today.

Seven months in a row now, they scoop us.
I mean, it's like they've got...
Sparkle cams hidden in all our walls.

Good. I guarantee you she has friends at Sparkle.

We need to make an unequivocal statement that Poise is still hot and happening.
Now, we need a newsstand circ analysis done immediately.

Uh, here are your messages, and this morning your mother called from Barbados.
I thought you said never to bother you with family calls.
I forgot that I said that.
Next time my mom calls, will you please let me know?
Oh, um, I have that information that you asked for.
Um, the phone number that you gave me was his parents'.
I told them that I worked for Visa and he is in a lot of trouble.

Um, hi, this is Jenna, and I'm looking for Matt, and I don't know if you're the right Matt, but if you used to live on Spruce Street and if your favorite shirt is the gray velour one, then I need to speak to you right now.
Uh, if you're here from Ming Gardens, ring twice.
If not, I really don't want it.
Oh, that's so weird, because yesterday you were there.
The thing is, it wasn't yesterday, because I'm not 13.
Uh, yeah. You know, it, uh, pays the bills.
Hey, Jenna, what are-- Why are you here?
Matty, I told you. Something really weird is happening.
Yesterday was my 13th birthday, and then...
And then today I woke up, and I'm this, and you, I mean, you're that!
I was sitting in my closet, and I... I...
You need to help me remember my life.
I don't know anything about you, all right?
I haven't seen you since high school.
Maybe I should open a window.
I think I need some fresh air and a glass of water and a fluffy pillow, please?
You want a glass of water?
You want a, uh, glass of water?
I want a fluffy pillow! Please!
A fluffy pillow, coming right up. Sorry.
Jenna, I think you should go back to your apartment.
Jenna, our lives went separate ways.
We went to different colleges, different careers.
I think I saw you through a frosted window once, six years ago.
Doesn't your crowd do St. Barts for Christmas?
This is where I live now.

JENNA: Matt, was I a Six Chick?
Uh, yeah, you were pretty much their leader.

I think you actually even work together.
Yeah, she's pretty big into the whole plastic surgery movement.
And I went with Chris Grandy.
I got everything I ever wanted.
Yeah, Jenna, you got it all.

Can you tell me where I'm going?
I'm going to a party in a limo!

Shoot. I forgot you have a job.

Well, if you decide you want to come, it's gonna be really fun.

What if what I wished for actually happened?
Well, then, you got everything you ever wanted.
You might as well enjoy it.
Why are you talking to me?
It's because I've got these incredible boobs to fill it out.
I've got like a zillion of 'em.
Can you tell I'm wearing underwear?
I think that's kind of the point.

Oh, God, no one's called me that since I had my nose job.
Can I have a lemonade, please?
Make it a piña colada, not virgin.
Do you want to see my I.D.?
Keeping you up, are we? Come on.
It's 11:00 on a school night and I'm at a party.

Sparkle's editor in chief, Trish Sackett, 12 o'clock and headed our way.
Our J.Lo issue is selling like hotcakes.
Are things so bad you had to come to our party to eat some free food?
Please, put some crab in your purse for later.
You might want to keep some of that biting wit for your magazine, or maybe you could just change the name to something more appropriate, like Poison or Pitiful.
You are rude and mean and sloppy and frizzy.
I don't like you at all.
Well, fortunately, I don't care about being liked.
Am I malodorous in any way?
Because people seem to be running for the exit like someone set off a giant stink bomb.
I think that he means the party is a stinker.
A dud, a flop, a zero on a scale of one to 10.
Well, maybe if somebody played something other than this.
Honey, play whatever you want to.

Oh, for the love of Pete.
I haven't done this in 15 years.
All right, let's go, let's go!
I've decided it's gonna be totally awesome.
You're thin, you're hot, you can get any guy you want, beyotch!
Not to mention, beyotch, the hottest magazine editor in the world.

Should I go talk to him?
because I think you're really cute.
So do you want to go out sometime?
Um, we're gonna take off now.
What, do you want to go to jail?
No more daiquiris for you tonight.
I can never find a taxi in this neighborhood.

You lost all your baby fat.

Did you get a nose job?
I'm doing some, uh, shopping with my, uh...
Jenna, this is Wendy, my fiancée.
Matt told me all about his blast from the past.

I don't know what I would've done without him.
I'm sure you'll be just fine.
I see you guys have spent so much time talking about me.
I do the weather for WWEN in Chicago.

This is my good friend, Matt, and this is his friend, Wendy.
I'm a big fan of yours.
You want me to sign your shirt or your forehead or something?
Sorry. I crack a lot of jokes after we win on account of because I'm in such a good mood.
Okay, well, uh, we should probably get going.
Nice to see you folks. Bye.

I actually had my eye on something a little better inside, so I'll see you guys later.
Should I go to his place?
You mean like games and stuff?
I couldn't wait to see you tonight.
You want to play a game?
Well, I call the blue board.
I owe you one raunchy striptease.
Who's got the moves on the ice and off the ice, ice, baby?
Wait, wait! I don't want to see that thing again!
He didn't have any games at all.
Oh, Becky, it's even worse than you think.
I mean, how come the ones that you like never like you?
Well, you have to fight for what you want.
Rule number one-- Love is a battlefield.
WOMAN: 57 ways to have an orgasm.
Uh, there's no easy way of saying this, so I'll...
Sparkle is closing in on a million.

Sparkle copies everything we come up with, everything we do, and we have to redesign?
Well, either we redesign and bring up our numbers, or they pull the plug.
Richard, redesign is a death sentence.
It's a chance to have some fun.
Let Sparkle have all our second-hand, stale, grody ideas.

Well, I shall be leaving it to my dynamic duo to come up with something utterly fabulous.

Oh, my God, that was so mean.

Tracy from the art department's husband.

I mean, she seems so... lost.

You know how she stole Charlotte's idea, right?
I say we go ahead with our own presentation and let her fall on her ass.
Want to go for a walk?
I still can't believe you're getting married.
I don't know if I believe in those.
I think that's kind of naive.

Uh, no, I haven't gotten crazy like that about a girl since high school.
I mean, how come we never stayed friends?

The Seven Minutes in Heaven and everybody ditched, and that is the last thing I remember.
Look, we don't have to get into this.
It's such a long time ago.

Well, you came out of the closet and, um, I started to sing my birthday song to you, and then you picked up and threw at me, with impressive force, I might add, the dream house that I spent three weeks building for you, and then, um, you just stopped being my friend, and you never spoke to me again after that, ever.
Matt, stop being so nice to me.
Do you know what kind of person I am now?
I mean, do you know who I am right now? I...
I don't have any real friends.
I did something bad with a married guy.
I don't talk to my mom and dad.
I'm not a nice person, and the thing is...
I missed you guys so much.
Do you ever wish you could go back?
I wouldn't mind giving back some of these wrinkles.
if you were given one do-over-- anything in your life-- what would it be?
But did you ever make a big mistake?
A huge one that could change your life?
Well, Jenna, I know I made a lot of mistakes, but I don't regret making any of them.
Because if I hadn't have made them, I wouldn't have learned how to make things right.
I'm sorry I missed last Christmas.
I was gonna stop by your office.
I actually tried to call you a bunch of times.

I actually wanted to talk to you about this whole redesign thing.

because I'm doing the same thing.

I'm not showing you my tongue.
Show me your tongue. Come on.

Matty, I need to see your tongue.
You want to know a secret?

I bet I can still beat you off the jump.

And dinner Friday night at 8:00 at the 24th Street Diner to celebrate our redesign being chosen.
No, you're not, because that means I am.
It's never quite got that reaction before.

Well, at least you have someone to dream about.

Aw. Francis is the dog's name.

Do you have any more-- Jenna.

I'm not trying to compliment you.
How long until your balls get totally squished?

The rest of the prints are ready.
Why does nobody listen to a word I say anymore?
Wait, I forgot my-- Oh. Oh, sorry.

We've got to go, um, to 23rd, please, between 5th and 6th.

How much time do we have?
I mean, from anything we've ever done, and I know you might hate it and think I'm completely crazy...
but I won't care, even if I get fired, and I don't mean that disrespectfully.

the girls from the soccer team.
Real women who are smart and pretty and happy to be who they are.
These are the women to look up to.

and fun, and laughter, and silliness, and...
I think all of us want to feel something...
that we've forgotten or turned our backs on...
because maybe we didn't realize how much we were leaving behind.

we won't recognize it even if it hits us between the eyes.

Jenna, I'm sorry to barge in on you like this, but I really have to talk to you.

Are you here about your photos?
I guess I should just tell you that...
that Jenna's decided to go in a different direction, with a more...

don't take it personally, because there's just a little bias.

Oh, that's great. I'll tell him when he gets back.

because we didn't stop to notice how much we were leaving behind.

If you don't mind, I'd like to be the pot.

Does it look familiar to you?

Editor in chief if you help them hit a million copies?

I might have told him something else too, but I just can't remember.
Because if you're single, I'd definitely want a number.

whoever that was she was talking about...
it doesn't matter what Lucy said.

I am not the awful person that I know that I was.
I don't even know that person, and I'd like to believe...
I have to believe that if you knew that, if in your heart, you really, really knew that, you wouldn't be getting ready to marry someone right now unless that someone were me.
I'm not gonna lie to you.
that I didn't know I could feel anymore...
but I have realized in these past few days...
you can't just turn back time.
